ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: some basics of international trade; quotas; tariffs; lobbying
More in depth trade theory and applications
Basics of International Trade economics
Class was ok. Learned about trade policy.
Econ
The most important themes in international trade
Knowledge of trade models and various trade concepts.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: low workload; seminar that you really don't have to participate too much in; kinda disorganized; last 4-5 weeks devoted solely to student presentations
I really enjoyed the course assignments, but sometimes I found the lecture hard to follow

Strengths: The presentations at the end were enjoyable to listen to, and it was much more engaging than the first half of the course. Also, Professor Maggi is really kind and approachable, very responsive over email.
Weaknesses: I was not very engaged in the lecture part of the course because a lot of it was review from previous courses and it was not very interesting (this may have been because it was over zoom).
Not that many opportunities for engagement til end of year
Interesting
Strengths: taught the most relevant material on the topic and incorporated both theory and empirical elements

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: online seminar not very engaging; difficult to get help on assignments
The latter part of the course was good, but the lectures could have been more adapted to online learning and engagement.
Was good
Not sure

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would, begrudgingly, but only to fulfill the senior seminar requirement. Over not a great class at all, but an easy way to finish my econ requirements
Yes! Its a great course if you want to learn more about trade

I would not recommend this course because I personally did not find it very interesting, but that may be because it was taught over Zoom and Professor Maggi mentioned not having any experience with online teaching.
Maybe
Yea!
As a senior year gut
Yes.
